TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit CommunicationObjectAbortedException extends System.ServiceModel.CommunicationException

Docs.summary: The exception that is thrown when the call is to an object that has aborted.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationObjectAbortedException> is a derived class of <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationException?displayProperty=fullName> and can occur in correct applications. Because typically the code that calls the <xref:System.ServiceModel.ICommunicationObject.Abort%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method reports the error condition that caused the call to <xref:System.ServiceModel.ICommunicationObject.Abort%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, this exception indicates that the call failed but the most useful error information is elsewhere.

Docs.param: The message carried in the exception.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified message.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Creates a new <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationObjectAbortedException> using the specified `message`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, valuetype System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: The that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The that contains contextual information about the source or destination.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class used to deserialize data into a object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor is called during deserialization to restore the exception object transmitted over a stream.
